title: Ticket #2767: usernames containing a period/dot cause problems in accounting groups
description:
LIGO is increasingly standardizing their user's global identities to be first.last name everywhere (e.g., "albert.einstein").

Condor may not like this; usernames with periods in them may be confused with accounting groups, etc.

In the original RUST, it was claimed it will be a while before this becomes a problem for them, and it seems that time has come.
remarks:
2012-Feb-10 14:44:30 by pfc:
Updated priority to match Todd's new scheme (1=fire, 2=soon, 3=time permitting, 4=not yet prioritized, 5=wishlist/ideas).

2012-Apr-19 16:27:23 by zmiller:
anyone have ideas for fixing this that doesn't break existing configs? if not, i propose changing the group/user separator to a ':' instead of a '.' for 7.8.0, and making sure it's clearly mentioned in the release notes. i haven't committed anything yet but will attach a potential patch that accomplishes this.

2012-Apr-23 10:54:58 by eje:
I think a good solution for this would be to make the separator configurable, and default it to the current '.', but allow an admin to set it to ':' (or something else they choose) if they want to. That will preserve backward compatability.

2012-Jun-18 15:23:19 by zmiller:
after some testing, it turns out this is probably not a big problem as the code does the intelligent thing here.

if a user "zach.miller" is used in a group hiearchy such as: AccountingGroup = top.middle.lowest.zach.miller

the code actually works backwards until it finds a valid group. so in the above case it would be Group==top.middle.lowest and User==zach.miller

there is possibility for problematic behavior if you name a leaf group the same as someone's first name. however, that seems unlikely, and we will deal with the real solution in the 7.9 series and leave 7.8 alone.

2012-Jun-26 15:26:00 by pfc:

Reopening at a lower priority, since we still want and need the "real solution in the 7.9 series" (we do have some user/group naming overlap) but it's not quite as critical as long as this works in 7.8.

2013-Jan-17 17:37:03 by eje:
My understanding of the current favored approach to this is to leverage the accountant's logic for attempting to assign the most-specific matching (sub)group, so that a dot in the user name will cause the desired behavior. (this may already be effectively happening, but should be tested)

Alternatively, have accountant look for a ':' (or some hard-coded choice - no configuration option), and if none is found, fall back on above.

2013-Jan-22 10:15:21 by johnkn:
/ seems more natural than : for a group hierarchy separator.
